title: 820-3437- B Not turning on
message:
I have a water damaged 820-3437-B board that is not turning on.

Originally there was corrosion on Q7630 causing 200ma draw on power supply. I replaced this chip along with C7622 and C7624. There is now a 70ma being drawn and no power.

Green light on charger/turns to orange. I have verified this will charge a battery. I went through every single power rail and all tested good. What might be causing this 70ma draw?

S5/S4/S3/S0 all good both 3.3V and 5V
PPBUS_G3H is 8.59V
PP342_G3h is 3.42V
PPDCIN-G3H is 18.5V

Thanks is advance

title: 820-3437- B Not turning on
message: Do you get voltage on all big coils?

title: 820-3437- B Not turning on
message:
Just checked voltages:
L7130 = 8.61V
L7520 = 5.1V
L7560 = 3.3V
L7430 = 1.20V
L7630 = 0.367V (should be 1.05V ?) There is a .29ohm short to ground on this line. I connected power supply @ 1.05V, 1.5A and cannot find the short. Dead cpu maybe?

title: 820-3437- B Not turning on
message:
Do you mean 0.29 ohm, or 0.290 in diode mode?

Post U7600 voltages, pins 6, 12, 16, 17.
Check its solders and traces.

title: 820-3437- B Not turning on
message:
PIN 6 - 1.80V
PIN 12 - 5.10V
PIN 16 - 3.30V
PIN 17  - 0.0V

And correction on short to ground. Its 40Ohm short to ground on L7630

title: 820-3437- B Not turning on
message:
That is no short at all.

Replace U7600 and check all surrounding components.
Pay atention to C7630 and R7630/31.

title: 820-3437- B Not turning on
message: I decided to replace U7600. Now the charger is taking 27ma and trying to turn on (bursts of 300ma every 3 secs) Still no boot

title: 820-3437- B Not turning on
message:
C7630 PIN1 = 500ma in bursts
C7630 PIN2 = 6-7V in bursts
R7631 = 1.2V in bursts
R7630 = 6-7V in bursts

title: 820-3437- B Not turning on
message:
Use an o-scope to catch peak pulse of L7630 output voltage.
The other coils pulsing too now?
